page.title: 19FRUIT FARMING
page.content: These trees are not planted for their fruit but for their pollen.Bees are also kept in the orchards to help with the pollination. Most of the trees at Mockbeggar are very short and can be picked without the use of ladders. Some of the plum frees,however,are not and special ladders have to be used when picking the fruit.The farm uses a lot of water for irrigation and because of this has its own resevoir holding 25 million gallons of water. A great amount of straw is also used at Mockbeggar. Straw is put around the bases of the trees to stop weeds, protect the roots from rabbits ,add goodness to the soil and protect the trees from frost.A lot of lime is also used because the soil is too acidic. Grass has been planted between the rows of trees on the sloping parts of the farm to prevent soil erosion.
